properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 10 at 2:43PM EST until February 13 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg
has issued a Flood Warning for the French Broad River At Blantyre
affecting Henderson and Transylvania Counties...

.Another round of heavy rain will develop across the region through
tonight resulting in rising river levels once again.

The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a

* Flood Warning for the French Broad River At Blantyre.
* from Tuesday to Thursday morning...or until the warning is cancelled.
* At 1:30 PM Monday the stage was 12.4 feet
* Minor Flood Stage is 16.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* FORECAST: The river will rise above Minor Flood Stage by Tuesday
afternoon and continue to rise to near 17.0 feet by early Wednesday
morning.
* Impact...As the river rises from 14.0 to 16.0 feet, farmland flooding
on both sides of the French Broad River develops. Floodwaters also
begin to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge and Crab Creek Roads.
properties.instruction:
The latest stages and forecasts for rivers can be found on our web
page at http://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
